slots.question: You're 13 days from Chicago with no backpacking destination picked and no gear sorted. You promised Mariano a warm weekend trip before his 30th.
slots.answer: Arizona and Southern Utah have 70°F+ temps mid-March — Superstition Wilderness near Phoenix needs no permit for overnight trips. REI rents full backpacking kits for ~$70/weekend including tent, sleeping bag, pad, and pack.
slots.next_step: Search 'REI Adventure Rentals backpacking package' and save rental cost + pickup location to your Chicago Craft doc

slots.question: You're hunting Sailor Pro Gear limited editions in Tokyo and ~$100 pens for your siblings. You have 23 days before the trip.
slots.answer: Sailor Pro Gear Slims run ¥22,000-35,000 ($150-240) — Tokyo limited editions at Kingdom Note in Shinjuku. For siblings: Pilot Custom 74 is ¥10,000 (~$70) in Japan vs $170 US. Itoya Ginza stocks both and has 12 floors of stationery.
slots.next_step: Save 'Kingdom Note Shinjuku' and 'Itoya Ginza' with addresses to your Tokyo Craft doc

slots.question: You have 3 days in Kyoto with no activity plan. Dana's 30th happens during this trip too.
slots.answer: Fushimi Inari has 10,000 vermillion torii gates you walk through — no reservation needed, best at sunrise. Arashiyama bamboo grove opens at 8am, gets crowded by 10am. Philosopher's Path is a 2km canal walk connecting temples.
slots.next_step: Add 'Fushimi Inari sunrise', 'Arashiyama bamboo before 10am', and 'Philosopher's Path' to your Kyoto Craft doc
